decks.notes: The key strategy of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures along with disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. With a mixture of efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, alongside hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Kolaghan's Command help provide additional value and versatility, making it a strong Aggro deck in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on utilizing cycling cards to fill up the graveyard quickly, then using cascade spells to cast Living End and bring back all the powerful creatures from the graveyard. By cycling through the deck efficiently and utilizing cascade spells effectively, the player can overwhelm their opponent with a sudden influx of powerful creatures onto the battlefield. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by destroying their lands with Fulminator Mage and controlling the board with Archfiend of Ifnir, while setting up for a game-winning combo with Living End.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early in the game with aggressive creatures such as Vengevine, Hollow One, and Flamewake Phoenix. The deck utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Insolent Neonate to quickly cycle through the deck and get these threats onto the battlefield as quickly as possible. Cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary provide additional bursts of speed and damage to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes a few versatile creatures like Walking Ballista and Hangarback Walker to provide additional utility and flexibility in different situations.

The deck revolves around utilizing discard spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through tokens and card advantage. It aims to apply pressure early with efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt. Kolaghan's Command and other versatile spells provide flexibility in dealing with various threats. The deck can also grind out games with Lingering Souls and Nahiri, the Harbinger, offering multiple avenues to victory. Overall, the strategy focuses on being proactive and disruptive to maintain control of the battlefield.

Utilizing a toolbox of creatures and combo pieces, this deck aims to ramp up with mana acceleration and tutor for specific creatures using Eldritch Evolution. By combining Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian, infinite token copies can be generated for a win condition. The deck also includes toolbox creatures like Renegade Rallier for value and disruption elements like Reflector Mage and Magus of the Moon. Sun Titan and Thragtusk provide additional midrange threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while providing flexibility for fetching with Wooded Foothills and Windswept Heath.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro - Hollow One deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting, Burning Inquiry, and Street Wraith in order to bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One, Flamewake Phoenix, and Gurmag Angler for cheap or free. The deck also utilizes cards like Bloodghast and Flameblade Adept to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of creatures, removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality, and disruption like Blood Moon, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing a wide array of human creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By using cards like Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to build a powerful board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while the mix of disruptive creatures and strong attackers makes the deck a formidable force in a Modern 1 vs 1 match-up.

The main focus of this deck is to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent using low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures. By quickly reducing the opponent's life total, the goal is to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a defense. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, along with powerful burn spells like Boros Charm and Lightning Bolt, to apply pressure and close out the game swiftly. The mana base is streamlined to ensure a fast and smooth curve for maximum aggression.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base with land destruction spells like Stone Rain and Blood Moon, while also ramping up its own mana with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. It aims to control the game by using powerful creatures like Inferno Titan and Bloodbraid Elf, along with card advantage from Tireless Tracker and Courser of Kruphix. The deck also has burn spells like Lightning Bolt and board control with Pia and Kiran Nalaar. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides additional card advantage and removal. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful board of Elves and leveraging their abilities to generate mana and overwhelm the opponent with a game-ending combo. By using cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling, the player can quickly search for key pieces such as Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to create infinite mana. This allows for explosive plays with cards like Ezuri, Renegade Leader to pump all elves to victory or to summon a massive threat like Westvale Abbey for a swift victory. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of powerful and synergistic creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing fast, aggressive Human creatures to overwhelm and disrupt the opponent. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to quickly flood the board with powerful creatures like Mantis Rider and Champion of the Parish. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Reflector Mage are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter help control the opponent's hand. The goal of the deck is to maintain pressure on the opponent while controlling the game with disruptive creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Human creature type to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. It maximizes the synergy between Human creatures such as Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter helps to control the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure with evasive threats like Mantis Rider. The deck also includes utility cards like Reflector Mage and Aether Vial to provide additional tempo advantage and versatility.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly cast a series of spells to build up mana and card advantage, while also utilizing cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells. The ultimate goal is to assemble a powerful combo by casting Gifts Ungiven to search for key cards like Grapeshot and Past in Flames, allowing the player to generate a large storm count and finish off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot. The deck aims to execute its combo quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

The deck focuses on assembling a fast and aggressive board presence using a mix of Human creatures and disruptive spells like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats that can quickly close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch helps to accelerate the deck's game plan, while cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Xathrid Necromancer provide additional disruption and resilience. The deck aims to establish early dominance and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main idea of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful colorless creatures and spells, such as Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Karn Liberated, while also being able to control the board with cards like Oblivion Stone and All Is Dust. The deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with big threats and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, card draw, and utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also incorporates a combo with Platinum Emperion and Madcap Experiment to create a powerful threat. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the board and win through card advantage and strategic plays. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon can also disrupt the opponent's mana base, further solidifying the control aspect of the deck.

The main concept of this KCI combo deck is to generate mana and card advantage through sacrificing artifacts like Terrarion, Ichor Wellspring, and Pyrite Spellbomb with Krark-Clan Ironworks to repeatedly loop artifacts from the graveyard with Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever. Engineered Explosives and Grove of the Burnwillows provide removal and lifegain, while Ancient Stirrings helps find combo pieces. Mishra's Bauble can be sacrificed for value and to trigger the combo. Inventors' Fair can tutor for important pieces. The goal is to assemble the combo quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful recurring effects.

This Modern Aggro - Humans deck focuses on quickly building up a strong board presence with low-cost creatures like Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant. By utilizing synergies between creatures and disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage to the opponent. Aether Vial and Ancient Ziggurat help to cast creatures efficiently, while Cavern of Souls ensures that the creatures can't be countered. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive tactics.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively utilize discard mechanics to quickly fill the graveyard, allowing for efficient casting of powerful creatures like Hollow One, Gurmag Angler, and Flamewake Phoenix. The deck's strategy revolves around playing threats early and relentlessly attacking the opponent, leveraging cards like Goblin Lore, Burning Inquiry, and Faithless Looting to maintain card advantage and keep pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Axe for additional reach and removal options to clear the way for its aggressive creatures.
